intro: Nonea schultesii, commonly known as the Schultesi's Nonea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
